TextBody:
Hello Serhat,

Below you can find the download links for a test build for both Win and Mac where the OpenSSL library was updated to version 3.0 LTS. This will remove some deprecated ciphers.

Windows: https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/Epp19112024/EppClient_v6.2.4.1004.zip
Mac: https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/Epp19112024/EPPMac3.0.4.1004.Notarized.tar

This change will also be applied to the EPP Clients from the 5.9.4.1 Server version.

Best regards,
Emil


--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]

To: serhat.demir@booking.com
Cc: oana.nemes@netwrix.com
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #414948 - - Client DPI Enables support for deprecated TLS versions and weak cipher suites [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0D4eLy:ref ]
 
Hello Serhat,

Thank you for the feedback.
I will add your feedback to the internal ticket.
Once I will get some news regarding other improvements I will let you know.

Best regards,
Emil


--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Serhat Demir [serhat.demir@booking.com]
Sent: 10/9/2024 4:55 PM
To: techsupport@netwrix.com
Cc: oana.nemes@netwrix.com; varun.aggarwal@booking.com; henrique.praxedes@booking.com; sanket.thai@booking.com
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #414948 - - Client DPI Enables support for deprecated TLS versions and weak cipher suites [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0D4eLy:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000D4eLy:ref

Hi Emil & Adrian,
 

I tested with EPP Agent v3.0.3.0024.

 

I attached the supported TLS cipher suites in the client side in Chrome and Firefox when DPI is enabled and disabled.

I can confirm that now deprecated TLS versions are disabled when DPI is enabled. Good, thanks.

Though, still, when DPI is enabled, the client supports many more weak cipher suites compared to the default behaviour as can be seen in the attached results. There is still room for improvement on that side for you to evaluate and consider.

 

Thanks,

-serhat


 

 


On Mon, Sep 9, 2024 at 2:05â€¯PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:



Hello Serhat, I received a cumulative test build for the following issues: 00416233 - EPP writes every ~10 seconds a 0 byte .tpm file in temp directory 00416109 - ERR_connection_closed error while accessing websites 00416619 - ERR_CONNECTION_RESET

 

Hello Serhat,

I received a cumulative test build for the following issues:
00416233 - EPP writes every ~10 seconds a 0 byte .tpm file in temp directory
00416109 - ERR_connection_closed error while accessing websites
00416619 - ERR_CONNECTION_RESET error while accessing websites
00415365 - Browsing issue when DPI is enabled
00414948 - Client DPI Enables support for deprecated TLS versions and weak cipher suites


Here are the download links for the agents (Windows+Mac):
Windows: https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/Epp09092024/EPPClient_v6.2.3.0057.zip
Mac: https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/Epp09092024/EPPMac3.0.3.0024.Notarized.tar

Please let me know if any of the issues can be still reproduced on your environment using the latest test build.

Thank you and Best regards,
Emil

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000D4eLy:ref
 
Hi Emil,
 

What is the solution? Is it to copy the default behaviour of the client or MitM will have a new limited set of TLS versions and cipher suites?

 

Thanks,

-serhat


 




 


On Mon, Aug 12, 2024 at 1:13?PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:



Hello Serhat, I have an update for this issue. The engineers are preparing a test build which will not allow the use of weak cipher suites. As soon as the build will be ready I will forward it to you. Best regards, Emil --------------- Original

 

Hello Serhat,

I have an update for this issue. The engineers are preparing a test build which will not allow the use of weak cipher suites. 
As soon as the build will be ready I will forward it to you.

Best regards,
Emil
